To simplify the rational expression (7x^2 + 14x) / (21x), we can first factor out the common factor of x from the numerator:

x(7x + 14) / (21x)

Now, we can factor out the common factor of 7 from the expression inside the parentheses in the numerator:

x(7(x + 2)) / (21x)

Next, we can cancel out the common factors in the numerator and the denominator. The common factor of x can be canceled out:

7(x + 2) / 21

Finally, we can cancel out the common factor of 7:

(7/7)(x + 2) / (21/7)

This simplifies to:

(x + 2) / 3

So, the simplified rational expression is:

(x + 2) / 3
